name: Human Deaths
desc: Annual number of human fatalities caused by this animal species (higher score = more dangerous to humans)

name: Hair/Feather Density
desc: Density and coverage of fur/hair/feathers on the animal's body (higher score = denser fur/feathers/more coverage)

name: Top Speed
desc: Maximum recorded speed of the animal (higher score = faster movement capability)

name: Lifespan
desc: Average or maximum lifespan in years (higher score = longer-lived species)

name: Population
desc: Current global population size and conservation status (higher score = larger/more stable populations)

name: Habitat Extent
desc: Geographic range and area of habitat distribution (higher score = wider distribution across regions)

name: Relative Strength
desc: Physical strength relative to body size and weight (higher score = stronger pound-for-pound)

name: Consumption by Humans
desc: Degree to which humans consume this species as food globally (higher score = more heavily consumed)

name: Captivity Population
desc: Number of individuals in zoos, aquariums, and captivity worldwide (higher score = more common in captivity)

name: Intelligence
desc: Cognitive abilities, problem-solving, and learning capacity (higher score = more intelligent)

name: Cultural Significance
desc: Importance in human culture, mythology, and symbolism (higher score = more culturally significant)

name: Bite Force
desc: Strength of bite measured in PSI or relative power (higher score = stronger bite)

name: Social Behavior
desc: Degree of social interaction and group living (higher score = highly social/pack animals)

name: Cuteness Appeal
desc: Subjective appeal and popularity as cute/adorable (higher score = cuter/more beloved)

name: Adaptability
desc: Ability to thrive in diverse environments and conditions (higher score = highly adaptable)

name: Economic Value
desc: Commercial worth including tourism, products, and industry (higher score = higher economic value)

name: Conservation Effort
desc: Amount of resources dedicated to protecting the species (higher score = more conservation programs)

name: Aggression Level
desc: Natural temperament and likelihood of aggressive behavior (higher score = more aggressive)

name: Heaviest
desc: Body mass in kilograms (higher score = heavier animal)

name: Lightest
desc: Body mass in kilograms (higher score = lighter animal)

name: Largest
desc: Length, height, or wingspan in meters (higher score = larger animal)

name: Smallest
desc: Length, height, or wingspan in meters (higher score = smaller animal)
